title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use \"t\" as the 25% solution and \"f\" as the 50% solution. The total amount of solution combined is 200, therefore we can determine that the first equation is $$t+f=200$$

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount is 40% of 200 (80) and there are 25% solutions and 50% solutions, we can determine that the second equation is $$0.25t+0.5f=80$$

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate t. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$t=200-f$$

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$t=200-f$$ using the second equation to get $$\operatorname{0.25}\left(200-f\right)+0.5f=80$$

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in t would be $$50+0.25f=80$$. We now isolate the variable \"f\" and get $$0.25f=30$$. Then, we can divide both sides by 0.25 to get $$f=120$$. There is 120 mililiters of 50% solution.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for \"f\", we can plug that value into the first equation to get $$t+120=200$$ which we can determine t to be 80 mililiters.
